COM.sootNsmoke.scheme
Class BindingEnv

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--COM.sootNsmoke.scheme.BindingEnv
public class BindingEnv
extends java.lang.Object

A binding environment maps symbols to values. This is also where we are going to keep the mapping of strings to symbols, which the reader uses. Also maintains a pointer to the previous binding environment. If you evaluate a symbol, we check up the stack if it isn't found here.

Method Detail

eval

public java.lang.Object eval(COM.sootNsmoke.scheme.Symbol sym)
                      throws UnboundException
Evaluate the symbol in this environment. If it isn't bound here, check up the stack. If it isn't bound anywhere, throw an UnboundException.

bind

public void bind(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object val)
Convenience: takes a symbol name, finds the symbol, and binds it to val

push

public BindingEnv push()
Push a new binding environment. That means creating a new environment which points to this one and returning it.

pop

public BindingEnv pop()
Pop a binding environment. That means returning my pointer to the previous environment.

makeVarArgs

public static Cons makeVarArgs(java.lang.Object[] vals,
                               int n)
Conses together everything on the stack after n
